column2: Towards the end of Winter Retreat 2018, Tan Suhajjo and the Abhayagiri Community ask Ajahn Pasanno questions related to monastic life.

column6: Session title
The Teaching and the Training
Celibacy, Symbol, and the Transcendent
From Restraint to Confidence

column3: 2018-03-20 The Monastic Form in the West.mp3
column6: The Monastic Form in the West
Being Your Own Refuge

column3: 2018-03-22 Caring for Monks in Aging, Sickness, and Death.mp3
column6: Caring for Monks in Aging, Sickness, and Death
Serving, Bowing, Images
The Role of Community
Dhutangas, The Ascetic Practices

column3: 2018-03-28 The Relationship Between Study and Practice.mp3
column6: The Relationship Between Study and Practice
Foundations, Community, Rebirth, Nibbana
Question text
The Buddha described his teaching as Dhamma-vinaya. Can you explain why it wasn't just Dhamma? What does this term mean?

In order to come to the training as Westerners, we often had to not follow cultural traditions and authorities. Monastic life has so many rules and the traditions are well established. How do we switch gears?
How do we expand our faith into other aspects of training?
Is vinaya about taking responsibility for your actions and mental states and how that affects other people?
Can you talk about skillful means to become more sensitive to the nuances of monastic training?
Can you talk about respect in the context of horizontal and vertical relationships in monastic life?
Are their multiple levels of brahmacariyā (celibacy)?
AN 7.50 Sexual Intercourse
Can you speak to the development of respect for the symbols of monastic life as opposed to respect for individual teachers?
I notice that you sometimes don't react to the seemingly disrespectful behavior of visitors.
Western culture seems to have no context for celibacy as a good thing.
Why are the precepts worded as things not to do rather than as aspirations?
You can't mandate goodness.
How does the Vinaya encourage monks to keep rules?
What is the role of confession and other tools for recifying offenses?
When the Buddha mentions stream entry, he often mentions both sīla (virtue) and view.
What about Sarakāni the stream enterer who took to drink?
SN 55.24-25 Sarakāni
Ajahn Chah takes in a gangster.
Can you talk more about "Skillfully contributing to an upredictable situation"?
Have you been in situations where you didn't know what to do?
I appreciate your saying "The trancendance of doubt isn't getting the answers to your doubt, it's being comfortable with the doubt."
When the suttas describe a practitioner as "having gone beyond doubt," what do they mean?
Ajahn Chah monk accused of heavy offense
What is the role of mentors and teachers in learning to use the monastic form skillfully?
Who were imporant mentors for you?
Ajahn Mahā Amon goes to study with Ajahn Chah.

Two questions: 1) What strengths do you see in other Buddhist traditions and Western culture that our tradition could benefit from? 2) How have you decided which aspects of korwat (protocols) from Thailand to adjust and which to maintain?
There are so many good things to do that you could be running around the country doing good things. I'd rather focus my attention here.
There's no reason to fit into American culture.
The monastic jacket is vindicated in England.
As Buddhist monastics and Buddhist practitioners, we're trying to set conditions that give us the opportunity for learning.
What can we learn when we pay respects to mentors?
Ajahn Maha Boowa visits after Ajahn Chah's death.
Ajahn Baen admonishes Ajahn Pasanno at Ajahn Chah's cremation.
You don't have to visit me! You know what to do already! It's all right here (pointing at his heart).
How many monks are with Luang Por Baen?
What about senior monks who don't meet our expectations of conduct or practice?
AN 4.192 Facts
Do you remember the sutta that compares people's behaivor to a puddle?
AN 5.162 Removing Resentment
Do you have any reflections on the "Do or die" attitude?
Can you talk about the dangers of misplaced or wrongly directed faith in a teacher?
A good teacher encourages people to practice and figure this out rather than telling them exactly what to do.
How does upatakhing fit into our training and what can we learn from it?
Ajahn Lee upataks Ajahn Mun.
I assume at Abhayagiri the upatakh sleeps in his own dwelling place? (in contrast to the previous story of Ajahn Lee)
What is the value of living in community?
Do you think it's true that how we treat others is in large part how we treat ourselves?
It's important for the Saṅgha to look after all members in terms of sickness and ageing.
Mv 8.26.1-8 The Monk with Dysentery
Why do upatakhs do things for their ajahns that the ajahns can do better themselves?
In Thailand, dāna (generosity) usually means giving food to a monk. But is dāna more of a mindset?
Can you talk about Ajahn Chah's use of communal pūjās and chores?
A Westerner asks Ajahn Chah, "Why do we bow?"
Can you clarify what "field of merit" means?
Why do we bow to images?
What about relics?
Ajahn Pasanno's mother observes multiplying relics.
What do you think might have happened to the few relics in my house when it burned down?
